name: Keyshia Cole
description:
'''Keyshia Myeshia Cole''' ([[Birth name|née]] '''Johnson'''; born October 15, 1981) is an American singer, songwriter, television personality and actress. Dubbed by [[music critics|critics]] as the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Princess of Hip-Hop Soul]]", she is known for her powerful vocal delivery and confessional songwriting. Born and raised in [[Oakland, California]], Cole began her career singing background vocals for [[MC Hammer]] before signing with [[A&M Records]] to release her debut studio album, ''[[The Way It Is (Keyshia Cole album)|The Way It Is]]'' (2005). Supported by the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] top-20 single "[[Love (Keyshia Cole song)|Love]]", the album received [[RIAA certification|platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) and earned two nominations at the [[2006 Soul Train Music Awards]]. Its success led Cole to film a [[reality television]] series for [[BET]], in which she documented her career, family and personal life: ''[[Keyshia Cole: The Way It Is]]''. The show ran for three seasons, and became one of the most-watched programs in the network's history.

Cole's second album, ''[[Just like You (Keyshia Cole album)|Just like You]]'' (2007), debuted at number two on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and was certified platinum, yielding three number-one singles on the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart: "[[Let It Go (Keyshia Cole song)|Let It Go]]" (featuring [[Missy Elliott]] and [[Lil' Kim]]), "[[I Remember (Keyshia Cole song)|I Remember]]" and "[[Heaven Sent (Keyshia Cole song)|Heaven Sent]]". Her third studio album, ''[[A Different Me]]'' (2008), also entered at number two and was certified platinum, while her fourth release, ''[[Calling All Hearts]]'' (2010), reached number nine and featured the singles "[[I Ain't Thru]]" (featuring [[Nicki Minaj]]) and "[[Take Me Away (Keyshia Cole song)|Take Me Away]]".

In 2012, Cole's fifth album, ''[[Woman to Woman (Keyshia Cole album)|Woman to Woman]]'', peaked at number ten on the US ''Billboard'' 200 and included the top-10 R&B single "[[Enough of No Love]]" (featuring [[Lil Wayne]]), and she starred alongside then-husband Daniel Gibson in her second BET reality series, ''[[Keyshia & Daniel: Family First]]''. Following a label shift to [[Interscope Records]], she released her sixth ''[[Point of No Return (Keyshia Cole album)|Point of No Return]]'' (2014), which debuted at number nine in the US, and headlined her third BET reality series, ''[[Keyshia Cole: All In]]'', the following year. In 2017, after joining the main cast for the [[Love & Hip Hop: Hollywood season 4|fourth season]] of [[VH1]]'s ''[[Love & Hip Hop: Hollywood]]'', she issued her seventh album, 11:11 Reset, via [[Epic Records]]; the album spawned the singles "[[You (Keyshia Cole song)|You]]" (featuring [[Remy Ma]] and [[French Montana]]) and "[[Incapable (Keyshia Cole song)|Incapable]]".

From 2019 to 2020, Cole the [[Fox Soul]]-[[broadcast syndication|syndicated]] talk show ''[[One on One with Keyshia Cole]]''. and in 2020 launched her own imprint, Hearts and Stars, in partnership with [[Bertelsmann Music Group|BMG]]. Cole executive-produced and starred in her own [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]]-original biographical documentary in 2023, and maintained a rigorous [[concert tour]]ing schedule across North America and Europe throughout 2024 and 2025. Over her career, Cole has earned multiple award nominations—including four [[Grammy Award|Grammy]] nominations—and achieved multi-platinum album sales, establishing her as a prominent figure in the [[contemporary R&B]] genre.
